intro: Columnea ceticeps, commonly known as the crimson flame plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy texture and a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Columnea ceticeps is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
